headline: Quick Baked Chicken Parmesan
description: This baked chicken Parmesan is quick to put together for a tasty midweek meal and fancy enough for dinner parties. Pairs perfectly with spaghetti.

video.description: This is a delicious baked chicken parmesan.
video.name: Quick Baked Chicken Parmesan

name: Quick Baked Chicken Parmesan

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Whisk water and egg together in a bowl until smooth. Combine bread crumbs, 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese, oregano, basil, thyme, and garlic powder in a separate bowl.
Dip each chicken breast in egg mixture, allowing excess egg to drip back into bowl. Coat each chicken breast in bread crumb mixture, shaking off excess.
Repeat dipping each coated chicken breast in egg mixture and the bread crumb mixture for a double-coating and place in the prepared baking dish. Spray breaded chicken breasts with cooking spray.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes.
Pour spaghetti sauce over each chicken breast and top each with mozzarella cheese and remaining Parmesan cheese.

Continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the cheeses are melted, about 15 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I made it without changes and it tasted great!
easy and tastes great
Super easy and Super Good!
super easy to follow :) and my family really liked it :)
Did a few adjustments for me. We loved it
If your looking for an unfried, healthier chicken parmesan - This is absolutely the best any simple to cook dish. Excellent!
The chicken turned out very moist and tender.

I made this dish for dinner last night and my husband said babes this is now my favorite dish. I didn't change anything. However, I did not measure out any of the seasonings..I just seasoned the chicken and placed it in the oven...It was really easy to make..will definitely make again!!
I was so good and my daughter an her boyfriend loved it!!! Followed it exactly
I followed the recipe except I doubled it. Delicious, easy quick meal. Added cheesy garlic bread and salad.
Great Recipe made 2 changes added a cup of all purpose flour and fried in butter to brown before putting in the baking dish.

Really enjoyed this. How I got to be in my ___ decade of life without having/making a chicken parm recipe is a mystery. This is a good one. I used the quantities shown for 6 servings and used only two chicken breasts, which I pounded to about 1/2" thick. As a result, I cut back both cooking times by 5 minutes each. Worked out great, and I have extra breading to keep refrigerated for the next time.
Delicious! Made exactly as recipe states.

This recipe is so yummy and easy! I would agree with other reviewers that 40 minutes is too long for the first bake. I baked mine for 30 minutes, added the sauce and cheeses and baked for 15 more minutes and it was delicious! Not dry at all. Thank you for such a great recipe!
I followed the recipe and it was amazing! Thick chicken obviously takes longer to bake. ( +15 min). My wife is a chicken parm lover and she thought it was great!

Good, easy recipe BUT the baking temperature and time is way off. I can't imagine baking chicken breast for AN HOUR. It would be so dry. 

I'd recommend pounding the breasts out so they're all even, about 1/2". Then bake at 400 for 15 mins, top with cheese, and bake another 5-10 (check temp with a meat thermometer or cut a piece open).

Excellent as written. I like to pound the chicken breast thin, therefore cooking time will be about 10 minutes less. Because I used Italian bread crumbs, I had to cut back a little on the spices (cut in half). I only dipped in the breadcrumbs one time. Mu favorite sauce is Prego Roasted Garlic and Herb. Don't forget the important step of putting cooking spray on the top before placing in the oven!
It was easy and quick to make. Oh, and very tasty! The only thing I changed was using olive oil instead of the cooking spray (not a fan of the spray). Definitely a favorite to make now.
So delicious and simple! My husband raved about this meal. I served it with a simple tomato, mozzarella, basil salad. Yum! I will make it for us and friends.

THIS IS AMAZING!!! I made it on Saturday, and my family requested it again on Sunday! We put it over noodles, and I fixed extra sauce to poor over it. Simply amazing, and so easy to make. There is a lot of waste of the ingredients that you coat the chicken in...I may cut down on that mixture the next time.

Baking is the way to go! So simple. Like a few others, because I was in a hurry, I used already prepared Italian bread crumbs (gluten free for my daughter's allergies). Next time, I will try it with the seasonings as written. The whole family was impressed.

Baking is the way to go! So simple. Like a few others, because I was in a hurry, I used already prepared Italian bread crumbs (gluten free for my daughter's allergies). Next time, I will try it with the seasonings as written. The whole family was impressed.
it was amazing my family loved it
The chicken was very juicy and my family loved it
Quick, easy, and delicious. And it looks good too! Had some potatoes and broccoli with it. Very good!

I followed the recipe exactly, except I pounded the chicken so the cooking time would be shorter. 30 minutes and then another 10 after adding the sauce and cheese. It was moist, and done perfectly. Will make this again..
Great taste and easy to make!
Easy, and less messy than the traditional pan fried version. Lower calorie, too. As noted by others, the chicken was fully cooked after 20 minutes.
Good flavor and chicken was moist, but we prefer a crispier coating. I will try it again with lightly pan frying in olive oil and then baking it til done.
Fantastic, easy recipe. Substituted my own marinara, extra cheese. Excellent!

We all liked it! Baking the chicken rather than frying it is healthier Some things that I did differently - when I tried dipping the chicken in the egg for the second time, all of the breading fell off so I didn't do that for the rest of the chicken pieces. Cooked the chicken for 30 minutes instead of 40 as another reviewer suggested. Used homemade sauce. Chicken turned out moist. Will make this again.
Was delicious. I used Italian style bread crumbs instead of the seasonings and marinara for the sauce. Chicken was tender and flavorful.
I love this recipe, I have had it different ways but this one is quick, I slice my chicken though so it will cook faster and I used fettuccine this time in stead of spaghetti .
No it’s was good and easy to make
I love how straightforward this recipe is to make. Everyone in our family enjoyed, so we will add it to our dinner rotation.

Delicious, used thighs as I didn't have breasts. It came out in the oven just as well as frying , and also saved time.
It was juicy and tasty, loved this recipe.
Excellent and easy. Didn't find anything I wanted to or needed to change. Very tasty. I would highly recommend. I made it ahead of time and it was still very moist.
It will take less time to cook if you have thinner pieces of chicken...and a bit hard to tell if it's done b/c of being covered in the Panko break crumbs...but it's yummy!

Great recipe! I followed the recipe as written and found this to be the best and easiest chicken parmesan that I have ever tasted. I like that you bake this chicken and thus reduce the oil and calories.
I followed the recipe exactly, but with Italian bread crumbs. It was phenomenal! So easy and surprisingly delicious.
My son loved this! Only changed I made was I used Italian breadcrumbs and omitted some of the green seasonings. Turned out great!
Easy and delicious. Didn’t change a thing!

This was so easy to make and my family absolutely loved it. Other than adjusting for a serving for 4 and giving it a couple extra minutes to back for my oven, I followed the directions and it was a total hit, especially with my mom's sauce recipe. I absolutely will be making this again.
amazing!!!
Simple, delicious....a keeper.
Its good but i use tomato sauce not spaghetti and add flavour to the sauce
This dishes very easy to make but I would recommend using a little less thyme seasoning it overpowered the chicken.

I'm not a cook by any means, most things I make can be described best as edible. This was extremely simple and tasted great. Instead of mixing in the seasoning with the bread crumbs, I bought the Italian bread crumbs. My wife said I needed to make it again in the near future, thanks for the recipe.

I was looking for something different for dinner and I decided to try this. There is only my husband and I and we don't eat a lot anymore. I used 1 large chicken breast and followed the directions but decreased everything accordingly. It seems like lately everything I cooked lately is like I'm a novice and I burn it; but this came out really good and I seriously impressed myself. Very good. I highly recommend you try it

Simple, easy and delicious
Big fan of simple and real
Made this for a 10 ppl dinner party
Everyone loved it 
So much better than other fancy recipes from pretentious “celebrity chefs” which calls for too many ingredients and steps

This was outstanding! Had to re-calculate ingredients to make for two people, but after that, it was as uncomplicated to prepare and cook as a recipe can be (a blessing for a novice cook like me). The results were absolutely delicious, and we highly recommend this dish.
Made it and it turned out great. My family loved it. Thanks allreceipes!
Great recipe! I used fresh shredded Parmesan Cheese and added fresh basil to breading.... delicious!

This recipe is an easy, family pleasing recipe. I tried to stay as close to the original recipe as possible. I had seasoned Italian breadcrumbs so I did not need to add the seasoning specified in the recipe. I recommend using a baking sheet and rack instead of a regular backing dish. I used mine and the results were chicken breasts that were crispy on both sides. Once my chicken was cooked thoroughly, I turned on the broiler just long enough to get a pretty brown color on both sides before soooning a little sauce over and adding the cheese to each breast.

This is fabulous. Much easier than frying and very much the same taste. We loved it. Followed the recipe exactly Served with hot bread and salad. Easy, cheap and so very good. Thanks for a great recipe which will be used often.
Instead of mozzarella cheese I used Muenster and it was delish! Whole grain pasta to complement it.
Great recipe! Simple, tasty and quick! We ate it too fast to get a picture!??

Really delicious! I sliced my breasts in half so that they were thin. I baked them on a rack set inside a 9x13 pan which worked well. This is the first time I've made Chicken Parm without the bottom being mushy! I used a combination of traditional bread crumbs and panko crumbs and only dipped it in the egg and crumbs mixture once. I was afraid all of my crumbs would fall off in the egg for the second dip. It only needed about 20 minutes before I added the sauce and then 15 with it since the breasts were so thin. We served it over Orzo. Yummy! This will be my go-to Parm recipe.

I made the receipe as stated. It was good in flavor. The bottom was a little soggy. Could have done without that. I did put under the broiler for about a minute to brown the cheese a little more. Will make again
Lacked salt and pepper, otherwise great!

Not trying to be mean but I didn't like it only because I don't really like chicken but my mom loves chicken parmesan and she loved this. I made for a Home Ec project and thanks to this dish I got a 95. The only thing I messed up on was I almost put the breading into the egg mixture. Overall a good dish to make if your parents like chicken parmesan and I just like it with more cheese. The addition of the mozzarella and not just the parmesan.
I used Italian panko
This chicken parmesan was very easy to make and my family loved it!!!
I followed the recipe to a tee and It turned out great!
The chicken came out like rubber the crust did not stay on follow the regular chicken parmesan recipie instead. The chicken breast half were too thick also and needed to be filleted!
Loved this recipe , perfectly cooked and flavor was super. I will be making this again.
easy and excellent
all was well i love the taste

I’ve been making this for years. I don’t use an egg bath I just use a little milk to dip it in and the cook time is quite different I think I go 20 and then 15
And I add more sauce

I used seasoned breadcrumbs and followed the recipe--with the seasoned breadcrumbs, I could have used less oregano. Other than that, it was really good! I like the double dipping in the egg mixture. The breading stayed on and it was a nice flavor.
I only cut the recipe in half, and I will most definitely make it again. Totally awesome!
This recipe for Chicken Parm turned out good, very easy to make but delicious!
Will make it again . Did a few small changes but thats just for taste preference ! 5 stars.
I added more eggs and water because I used more chicken breast. I used crush tomatoes,tomato paste,& tomato sauce. I seasoned it to taste and my family loved it yummmmmmyyyy

Easy to make. Used a little more chicken and bumped up the other ingredients a bit, especially the mozzarella. Served over spaghetti with garlic toast. A big hit with all but a picky six-year-old. Definitely adding to my recipe collection. Thank you! ?

I made this for my wife / finicky daughters and they absolutely loved it! Chicken was so juicy, flavorful and convinced us to never make "fried" Chicken Parm again. Also, if you want to spice it up a little, here are a few tips:
- Breadcrumbs - split up total measurement for bread crumbs (2/3rd Panko | 1/3rd Herb/Garlic Bread Crumbs)
- Add a few dollops of either low fat ricotta or whipped cream cheese on top of each breast for the last 15 mins

Enjoy!
Made exactly as suggested and all 7 people loved it. Although it would be nice to have a crispier crust on the chicken, it satisfied the health-conscious that it was all baked.
First time trying this. Hopefully it'll turn out good. Or else my husband won't have dinner tonight.

I followed the recipe as is, although I pounded the breasts to shorten cooking time.
 Hubs liked it, and I thought it was OK~but next time I'll use more garlic + fresh basil for more flavor.
 It is a good recipe, and I like that the chicken is baked and not fried!
No changes. Delicious! Husband loved it and it will become a regular dinner entree. Quick and easy, great for weeknights!

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there was no salt in the recipe. I added a little to the egg and water mixture. I used boneless skinless thighs and made no additional changes. The next time will double the spaghetti sauce.
This was a great recipe!! We loved it but the next time would have sauce to add when eating. Otherwise it was perfect! Highly recommend...fast and easy.
I too would pound down the chicken first. We really enjoyed this easy recipe & I will use it again.
Instead of egg, I used Hellman's Mayo. Chicken was moist.
Loved this recipe! I had never made Chicken Parmesan for fear of it being too difficult. Found this recipe to be easy to follow and delicious. Family enjoyed it!

Will make again. I dipped the chicken in panko bread crumbs only one time versus twice. Toward the end, I put the oven on low broil and basted them with butter to help with browning. Crowd pleaser in my house!!
Made exactly as is. Used cheese sticks because I had them. We LOVED IT!! will make again.
I made my own tomato sauce by using can of tomatoes pureed and one small can of tomato paste instead of spaghetti sauce {didn't have any} and used panko instead of bread crumbs
Majority of the breading came off and wasn't sticking. Overall taste of the dish was pretty good.
I made this recipe and used the chicken breasts but subsituted a cacciatore recipe instead. Much better!

Loved it! The chicken came out very tender. Mine was fairly thick and was done ahead of the time listed. I used just one cup of breadcrumbs to trim calories, and used olive oil instead of cooking spray. I loaded my pasta sauce with peppers, onions, and carrots, and used fresh mozzarella instead of pre-shredded. Easy dish with little hands-on time.
Pounded the chicken breasts flat so cool time was much reduced (20 min, then 5 under broiler). Otherwise, made as written - delicious, moist and easy!
We never have to change a thing, this recipe is perfect.

I used chicken tenders instead of whole breasts so cut down cooking time by 15 min. I did not double dip, since that just seemed to make a mess but not add much. Otherwise followed the recipe. Tasty, moist chicken to top on some spaghetti.
This was delicious. Loved the breading!
Absolutley will make it again. Husband loved it so. I hope!

Really easy and really good. I bought store-bought thin-sliced chicken breast (they are pretty thin) so i cooked them a little less time but besides that followed the recipe word for word. Turned out great, Super easy and a really good flavor for being baked with very little fat. Will definitely make this version again - thanks!
Just follow the directions and you too can become a dinner time hero.

I followed the recipe exactly except I didn't bake the sauce over the chicken in the oven. I wanted it pretty, so I cooked it on the stove to reduce it a little and get it hot. Then I put spaghetti noodles in a dish, placed the chicken on top, added the sauce, and topped it with the mozzarella. then I put it back in the oven to melt the cheese. Tasted great and looked pretty.
